main.name: Benjamin R. Luginbuhl
main.occupation: PhD Candidate   |   Data Scientist   |   Software Engineer   |   Educator
main.bio: Hi, my name's Ben. I'm a PhD candidate in Chemistry at the University of California, Santa Barbara. I love all things related to energy science, education, and design. This website is a place for me to put my resume out in the world, as well as to hone my web design skills.
main.contactmessage: The contact form is not currently implemented! Please get in touch by emailing me directly: ben.luginbuhl (at) gmail.com

resume.skillmessage: Here are a few selected skills and my self-rated proficiencies.

education.description: I work primarily in the group of Professor Quyen Nguyen. My research focuses on understanding the underlying physics of organic semiconductor devices, including solar cells, photodetectors, and light-emitting diodes.

Graduated magna cum laude (GPA 3.89) with minors in Biology, Mathematics, and Physics. I did research in the labs of Dr. Cindy Browder and Dr. Constantin Ciocanel on device physics of structural supercapacitors.

work.title: Software Engineer - Intern
work.description: Invoca is an AI-powered call-tracking and analytics company. My work at the company is focused on web application development using Ruby on Rails and ReactJS.

work.title: Graduate Teaching Assistant
work.description: I teach General Chemistry labs, including honors sections. I also work in the Mass Spectroscopy Facility.

projects.title: Canadian Wanderlust

projects.category: (offline now) A fighting gear company I started

projects.title: Smirkspace

testimonials.text: Here you should write some nice things that someone has said about you. No lies though, employers can tell when you are lying.

That Tim Baker must be one of the most brilliant developers I've ever met! It is amazing that nobody has hired him yet. Hey you, you should hire this guy, he may be fresh out of University and have zero on the job experience but I am confident that he will be one of your best developers in no time!
